channel.title: Ruth Asawa on Artangled

item.title: Ruth Asawa: Citizen of the Universe | Modern Art Oxford
item.description: I first saw work from the American artist and educator Ruth Asawa in a show at David Zwirner, just before COVID hit. I was pretty captivated by her weightless sculptures made of wire, hanging from the ceiling like shoals of jellyfish. Back in the UK a couple of years later, sheâ€™s taken over an even larger space, the upper floors of Modern Art Oxford, in an exhibition that showcases a broader variety of her work, and the ideals that informed it.
